messages.title: CONSREVATIVES ANNOUNCE HUGE BOOST FOR LOCAL SCHOOLS
messages.content: Geoffrey Cox has secured a massive boost for local schools, helping reverse decades of underfunding.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secured a commitment to increase school funding, an immediate 5% under a Conservative Government, rising further to £5,257 per pupil for primary schools and £5,433 for secondary schools in 2020-21. A special package worth £700 million to make sure extra support is available for those with special education needs and disabilities.

issues.economy: Responsible economic management means we can give this boost to our schools.
issues.education: Secured a commitment to significantly increase school funding over the next three years.

leaflet.personalStatement: After listening to parents and teachers in his regular visits to local schools, Geoffrey made a powerful case for better funding for our schoolchildren at the heart of Government.

politicalExperience.achievements: Made the case for extra funding in Westminster and Whitehall, securing a 15% budget increase in the next 3 years for schools in Torridge and West Devon.

images.caption: Geoffrey on one of his regular visits to local schools, listening to pupils, teachers and parents.
